instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fully functional but power button doesn't work on battery only
threads.message: This one is baffling me. Everything works normally. Not liquid-damaged. Computer works fine on battery. Power button works fine with adapter plugged in. But the power button will not do anything with only the battery connected. Tried known good battery and keyboard. No change. Installed working board and everything is normal. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fully functional but power button doesn't work on battery only
threads.message: Voltage on SMCONOFF with and without charger? I would still suspect corrosion under SMC though.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fully functional but power button doesn't work on battery only
threads.message: 3.4V on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> in all scenarios - battery only, no battery, charger with battery. Power button will actually turn off computer with battery-only but it will not turn it on. Turns on and off fine with charger. There is no sign at all of spill-damage but I did just notice that the SPI looks like it was messed with. Not sure if that might have changed things and could be causing this. Or maybe something in the surrounding area was affected when the SPI was removed and resoldered.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fully functional but power button doesn't work on battery only
threads.message: I suspect crap under the SMC, inspect for liquid damage.
